background: A mail delivery service must deliver mail using regular and speed boats, each having different capacities and fuel usage, with a constraint on the number of regular boat trips and a minimum proportion of trips that must be speed boats.
constraints: Number of regular boat trips is non-negative
Number of speed boat trips is non-negative
Number of regular boat trips is at most MaxRegularTrips
At least MinSpeedPercentage of the total number of trips are made by speed boats
Total pieces of mail delivered is at least TotalMail
objective: Minimize the total amount of gas consumed for delivering all the mail
description: A mail delivery service in an island village delivers mail by regular and speed boats. A regular boat can carry \param{RegularCapacity} pieces of mail per trip and uses \param{RegularFuel} liters of gas. A speed boat can carry \param{SpeedCapacity} pieces of mail per trip and uses \param{SpeedFuel} liters of gas. There can be at most \param{MaxRegularTrips} regular boat trips. Since customers want their mail as fast as possible, at least \param{MinSpeedPercentage} of the trips must be made by speed boats. If the service needs to deliver \param{TotalMail} pieces of mail, how many trips of each should be made to minimize the total amount of gas consumed?

parameters.definition: Maximum number of mail pieces a regular boat can carry per trip
Fuel usage of a regular boat per trip
Maximum number of mail pieces a speed boat can carry per trip
Fuel usage of a speed boat per trip
Maximum number of regular boat trips allowed
Minimum percentage of trips that must be made by speed boats
Total number of pieces of mail to be delivered
